content:
# It appears that the smelting process has produced 5 additional iron plates in the furnace, but my inventory still shows only 3 iron plates. 
# This indicates that I have not extracted the new plates yet.

# My current inventory is:
# - 2 wood
# - 5 stone
# - 10 iron ore
# - 3 iron plates
# - 7 iron gear wheels

# I will now extract the 5 iron plates from the furnace to bring my total to 8 iron plates in my inventory.

# Extracting the iron plates from the furnace.
extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace, quantity=5)

# Checking inventory after extraction.
print(f"Inventory after extracting iron plates: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Now I should have:
# - 8 iron plates (3 previously + 5 extracted)
# - 7 iron gear wheels
# 
# I still need 2 more iron gear wheels to reach the required 10 for the assembling machine.
# 
# Since I have 8 iron plates, I can craft 4 more iron gear wheels (as each requires 2 plates). 
# I will craft as many as I can.

# Crafting additional iron gear wheels
for _ in range(4):  
    if inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 2:
        craft_item(Prototype.IronGearWheel)

# Checking inventory after crafting additional iron gear wheels
print(f"Inventory after crafting additional iron gear wheels: {inspect_inventory()}") 

# Finally, I will check if I now have enough materials to craft the assembling machine.
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronGearWheel, 0) >= 10, "Not enough iron gears to craft the assembling machine"
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 10, "Not enough iron plates to craft the assembling machine"
assert inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.Wood, 0) >= 5, "Not enough wood to craft the assembling machine"

# Now, I can proceed to craft the assembling machine!
craft_item(Prototype.AssemblingMachine1)  # Crafting the assembling machine

# Checking inventory after crafting the assembling machine
print(f"Inventory after crafting the assembling machine: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
